parameters.definition: Food waste units generated by the original meal
Wrapping waste units generated by the original meal
Cooking time for the original meal
Food waste units generated by the experimental meal
Wrapping waste units generated by the experimental meal
Cooking time for the experimental meal

description: A restaurant has two combos available to their customers, an original and an experimental meal. The original meal typically generates \param{WasteFoodOriginal} units of food waste and \param{WasteWrapOriginal} units of wrapping waste and takes \param{TimeOriginal} minutes to cook. In comparison, the experimental meal generates \param{WasteFoodExperimental} units of food waste and \param{WasteWrapExperimental} units of wrapping waste and takes \param{TimeExperimental} minutes to cook. The restaurant can have at most \param{MaxWrapWaste} units of wrapping waste and can have at most \param{MaxFoodWaste} units of food waste as regulated by the government. How many of each combo should be pushed for by the waiting staff to minimize the cooking time?
